solution_line_template: Julian's number of friends who are girls is {julian_girl_fraction}*{julian_total_friends} = <<{julian_girl_fraction}*{julian_total_friends}={julian_girl_friends}>>{julian_girl_friends}

Boyd has twice as many friends as Julian who are girls, a total of {boyd_girl_multiplier}*{julian_girl_friends} = <<{boyd_girl_multiplier}*{julian_girl_friends}={boyd_girl_friends}>>{boyd_girl_friends}
If Boyd has {boyd_total_friends} friends, he has {boyd_total_friends}-{boyd_girl_friends} = <<{boyd_total_friends}-{boyd_girl_friends}={boyd_boy_friends}>>{boyd_boy_friends} boys

The percentage of boys in Boyd's Facebook friends is {boyd_boy_friends}/{boyd_total_friends}*{percent_multiplier} = <<{boyd_boy_friends}/{boyd_total_friends}*{percent_multiplier}={boyd_boy_percent}>>{boyd_boy_percent}
